Author: Chinua Achebe (Nigeria)
Description: Published in 1958 by William Heinemann, a major London publisher known for shaping postcolonial literature; located in Westminster, a district tied to major literary and political institutions.

Author: Ngũgĩ wa Thiong’o (Kenya)
Description: Published in 1967 by Heinemann’s African Writers Series; Acre House in NW1 is known as a hub for international educational and literary publishing.

Author: Mariama Bâ (Senegal)
Description: The English edition was published in 1981 by Heinemann’s African Writers Series; NW1’s literary district played a key role in circulating African feminist writing globally.

Author: Tsitsi Dangarembga (Zimbabwe)
Description: Published in 1988 by The Women’s Press, a feminist publishing house in Mayfair, known for supporting women’s writing and activism.

Author: Amos Tutuola (Nigeria)
Description: Published in 1952 by Faber & Faber, one of Britain’s most influential literary publishers; positioned in a historic postcolonial publishing corridor.
